channel.title: IP address problem?
channel.description:
Right,
So here's the problem...
I am currently hosting a server. People can log in and everything using my IP address for my internet. But for some reason, it changes daily. I want to set up an IP address that won't keep changing every day and so that it will just stay the same until I end up giving up.
Please help.
No trolls please, as I am new to this.
- Jim

item.title: IP address problem?
item.dc:creator: @skypescape skypescape
item.description:
@skypescape wrote:

[quote=“xI c E, post:2, topic:440105”]I believe if you set up a hostname on No-IP.com and then download their update client, it will check every 5 minutes if your IP has changed and if it has, update the hostname automatically with the new IP.[/quote] yes i need help!!! add me on skype pleasss

Read full topic

item.title: IP address problem?
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

xI c E:

I believe if you set up a hostname on No-IP.com and then download their update client, it will check every 5 minutes if your IP has changed and if it has, update the hostname automatically with the new IP.

Yup.

[quote=“Its ema, post:3, topic:440105”]Jim, just set-up a static ip adress. Your ip right now is a dynamic one. It keeps changing.

You can use this: http://portforward.com/help/setup_static_ip_address.htm

Very simple and easy.[/quote]

Think he’s talking about external IP’s.

Read full topic

item.title: IP address problem?
item.dc:creator: @Its_ema Its ema
item.description:
@Its_ema wrote:

Jim, just set-up a static ip adress. Your ip right now is a dynamic one. It keeps changing.

You can use this: http://portforward.com/help/setup_static_ip_address.htm

Very simple and easy.

Read full topic

I believe if you set up a hostname on No-IP.com and then download their update client, it will check every 5 minutes if your IP has changed and if it has, update the hostname automatically with the new IP.
